intro: Tradescantia ambigua, commonly known as spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, three-petaled flowers in shades of blue, purple, or white, typically blooming in spring and summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Tradescantia ambigua is also known for its ability to spread via runners, making it both a decorative garden plant and a potential weed.
